meanings.definition: A vessel or receptacle used in Roman Catholic and Anglican churches to display the consecrated Eucharistic host for adoration.
meanings.sent1: The ostensorium was beautifully decorated with gold and jewels.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the priest held the ostensorium high for all to see.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the ostensorium was a spaceship flying through the church.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an ostensorium, radiating warmth and joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The ostensorium gleamed in the candlelight, drawing the eyes of the faithful towards it.

meanings.definition: A sacred vessel used to hold and display the consecrated Eucharist during Eucharistic adoration.
meanings.sent1: The priest carefully placed the Eucharist in the ostensorium.
meanings.sent2: The ostensorium was made of pure silver, reflecting the solemnity of the occasion.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the ostensorium, thinking it was a fancy food bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like an ostensorium, carrying the sacred words to the hearts of the congregation.
meanings.sent5: The ostensorium stood on the altar, a symbol of divine presence among the worshippers.
